revised_title: On the Placentation of Lemurs and Movement of the Glass Case of a Radiometer
tldr: This article discusses the placental structure of lemurs and the movement of a glass case containing a radiometer. The author, Wm. Turner, examines the gravid uteri of various lemurs and concludes that their placenta is diffused and non-leciduate. Additionally, William Crookes presents an experiment involving a radiometer, which provides insights into the theory of these obscure actions.
